summary: This is an email from FBI New York to FBI CID discussing coordination with the UK's National Crime Agency (NCA) regarding the Epstein investigation. It references an attached document from NCA, a potential internal investigation into 'Care Iveagh', and financial intelligence about Epstein's U.S. bank account.

events.title: CID Inquiry to FBI NY
events.description: FBI CID sends an email to FBI NY regarding an attached document from the UK's National Crime Agency (NCA), a potential internal NSPCC investigation into 'Care Iveagh', and financial intelligence on Epstein's U.S. bank account.

events.title: FBI NY Response to CID
events.description: An FBI New York agent responds to the CID inquiry, stating they will discuss the matters with their investigative team and get back to them.

keyFacts: The UK's National Crime Agency (NCA) provided a document to the FBI related to the Epstein investigation.
There is a question about whether an internal NSPCC investigation into 'Care Iveagh' would adversely affect the FBI's Epstein investigation.
NCA has financial intelligence regarding a U.S. bank account associated with Jeffrey Epstein and offered to route it via FinCEN if of interest to FBI New York.
The email shows ongoing international coordination (US-UK) on the Epstein case as of August 2020.
